title: Upgrade EduBridge roles, entry selection, request forms, offline meeting notice, and accept/reject notifications (preserve existing design)

requirements.text: Add a new user role named "client" across the app, so users can register and be treated distinctly from students, businesses, and freelancers/helpers.

quotes: Upon visiting the website, users should see three options: "Student," "Client," and "Business,"
For each user type, the following fields should be included:
For clients: Title of the work requested (e.g., freelancing task) and a brief description box for specifics.

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes a new UserRole variant for client alongside existing roles.
Frontend role selection supports client without TypeScript/type errors.
Client users can authenticate and navigate to the correct post-login destination (dashboard or request submission flow) without being treated as helper/freelancer.

requirements.text: Update the landing ("/") experience to include a clear entry selection section with exactly three prominent options: "Student", "Client", and "Business", using appealing transition-style typography/animation consistent with the current site style (do not redesign the overall theme).

quotes: Upon visiting the website, users should see three options: "Student," "Client," and "Business," presented with appealing transition fonts.
Keep the designs and everything same as now in my existing website. But make the up listed changes

acceptanceCriteria: Landing page shows three selectable options: Student, Client, Business.
Each option uses a noticeable, tasteful transition/animated text treatment that matches the existing visual language (glass/gradient/animations already used on the site).
Selecting an option routes the user into the appropriate next step (account creation and/or request submission), without breaking existing Create Account / Login buttons.

requirements.text: Update the Create Account flow to support the new "Client" role and keep existing roles working; ensure all user-facing role labels are in English and consistent (Student, Client, Business, and existing Freelancer/Helper if still supported).

quotes: A login/create account page for users to access the platform.
Keep the designs and everything same as now in my existing website. But make the up listed changes

acceptanceCriteria: Create Account role picker includes Client as a selectable role.
Existing roles (Student, Business, and existing Freelancer/Helper) continue to work as before.
After profile creation, users are redirected based on their selected role without loops or access denied errors.

requirements.text: Upgrade the authenticated request submission form (currently routed at "/work-request") to capture and submit, for Student/Client/Business: Name, Age, Title, and Description (with role-specific helper text/examples matching the user request).

quotes: For each user type, the following fields should be included:  - Name  - Age
For students: Title of work (e.g., assignment, homework) and a brief description box for details.
For clients: Title of the work requested (e.g., freelancing task) and a brief description box for specifics.
For businesses: Title of the service/product and a brief description box for elaboration.

acceptanceCriteria: Work request form includes fields for Name and Age in addition to Title and Description for Student, Client, and Business submitters.
Role-specific labels/help text are shown (e.g., Student: "Title of work (assignment/homework)"; Client: "Title of work requested (freelancing task)"; Business: "Title of service/product").
Submitting the form persists Name and Age with the request data in the backend (not only in localStorage).
Only Student, Client, and Business roles can submit requests via this page; helper/freelancer role is not allowed to create requests unless explicitly retained by existing product logic.

requirements.text: Add submission mode options "Online" and "Offline" to the request form for Student/Client/Business. If "Offline" is selected, show an on-screen notification containing exactly: "Meet at Moon Bake, Kengeri Satellite Town, Bangalore 560060." and ensure the submitted request is marked/stored as offline with that location information.

quotes: If "Offline" is selected, show a notification with details to meet at "Moon Bake," Kengeri Satellite Town, Bangalore 560060. This should apply to students, clients, and businesses.

acceptanceCriteria: Request form provides a clear Online/Offline selection control.
When Offline is selected, the UI displays the required meeting notice text verbatim in English.
Offline submissions store the meeting location details in the backend request so the owner can see it in the inbox/detail views.
Online submissions do not show the meeting notice and are stored as online (not offline).

requirements.text: Ensure that after Student/Client/Business submit a request, it is visible to the owner/admin for review in the existing owner inbox and detail pages, and the owner can accept or reject it and initiate conversation with the user.

quotes: After submitting their details, the information should be sent to the owner (myself) for review. I should have the ability to accept or reject requests and initiate conversations with users.

acceptanceCriteria: New/updated request fields (Name, Age, submission mode/location) are visible to the owner in Owner Inbox and Owner Request Detail views.
Owner can accept or reject pending requests as before.
Owner/admin can initiate chat messages to the request owner using the existing chat functionality (no permission errors).

requirements.text: Implement acceptance/rejection notifications to the submitting user: when the owner/admin accepts a request, the user receives a confirmation message; when rejected, the user receives a rejection message encouraging them to try again. Notifications must be in English and delivered within the app (e.g., as an automatic chat/system message tied to the request, and/or a status banner in the user dashboard).

quotes: Upon accepting a request, send a confirmation message to the respective user. If rejected, send a message indicating the request was rejected and encourage them to try again.

acceptanceCriteria: On admin acceptance, the submitting user can see an explicit confirmation message associated with that request (not only a status change).
On admin rejection, the submitting user can see an explicit rejection message that encourages them to try again.
Messages are generated automatically at the time of accept/reject and do not require the owner to manually type them.

requirements.text: Preserve the existing website look-and-feel while implementing the above changes; do not introduce a new theme. If any new UI elements are added (entry selection, new fields, online/offline controls), they must reuse the existing glass/gradient/animation patterns already present in the app for a consistent experience across devices.

quotes: Keep the designs and everything same as now in my existing website. But make the up listed changes
Ensure that the design is user-friendly, visually appealing, and functions smoothly across different devices.

acceptanceCriteria: New UI components visually match current styling (cards/buttons/gradients/glass effects).
All upgraded flows are responsive and usable on mobile and desktop.
No regressions to existing pages (Landing, Login, Create Account, Owner Inbox/Detail, dashboards) in layout or theme variables.

requirements.text: Provide a comprehensive implementation guide/design specification inside the repo that documents: roles (Student/Client/Business/Helper/Admin), the entry-selection flow, all form fields, submission-mode behavior (Online/Offline + Moon Bake notice), and the accept/reject notification behavior (including exact user-facing message copy).

quotes: I have experience in web development but would appreciate a comprehensive plan to guide the implementation of these features

acceptanceCriteria: A written spec exists in the frontend/docs or root docs describing the upgraded flows and data fields.
The spec includes the exact English copy for the Offline meeting notice and accept/reject messages.
The spec matches the implemented behavior (no mismatches between doc and app).

constraints: Maintain the existing visual design/theme; only add/adjust UI necessary for the requested features.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose existing shadcn components instead).
Do not edit immutable hook/bootstrap paths listed by the system (e.g., frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x), frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx).
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; only add a migration file if required for stable state compatibility.
nonGoals: Integrating third-party authentication providers beyond Internet Identity.
Adding real-time communication via WebSockets/push notifications/email/SMS.
Adding external databases or multiple backend services.
Building a brand-new UI theme or redesigning the entire landing page structure beyond inserting the requested entry selection section.
